article.title: 13 Best Things To Do In Venice, Italy At Night
article.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the beautiful city of Venice! This ancient city has a long history and features in many creative works of art, because it really has to be seen to be believed. At night-time, the city might be wearing a deserted look. However, there is no shortage of clubs, pubs, bars and other attractions where you can spend the night.

snippets.title: 1. Relax watching shows at the Musica a Palazzo
snippets.title_with_numbering: 1. Relax watching shows at the Musica a Palazzo
snippets.description:
Venice naturally lends itself to the fine arts. If you want to spend the night enjoying some entertainment, this is the place to be. You can book tickets online as well. The location overshadows the grand canal. The mansion where the opera takes place has very neatly decorated rooms featuring works of art from renowned artists.

> #### Musica a Palazzo
>
> **Address**: Palazzo Barbarigo Minotto, Fondamenta Duodo o Barbarigo, San Marco 2504, 30124 Venice
>
> **Website**: [Musica a Palazzo](http://www.musicapalazzo.com/language/en/)

snippets.title_with_numbering: 3. Have drinks at the Caffé Florian

snippets.title: 5. Party all you want at Molocinque
snippets.title_with_numbering: 5. Party all you want at Molocinque

snippets.title: 6. Be amazed at the interesting exhibits at Doge's Palace
snippets.title_with_numbering: 6. Be amazed at the interesting exhibits at Doge's Palace
snippets.description:
Doge's Palace is no ordinary museum. Not only does it have an awe-inspiring architecture, there are even residential apartments and prison cells inside. If you are visiting the museum on a Friday or Saturday, the admission queue is open till 10 pm, but on other days admission closes at 6 pm. You can book tickets online. Don't miss the 'hidden treasures' itinerary!
> #### Doge's Palace
>
> **Address**: Piazza San Marco | O, 31024 Venice, Italy
>
> **Website**: [Doge's Palace](http://palazzoducale.visitmuve.it/en/home/)

snippets.title: 7. Read books at Libreria Acqua Alta
snippets.title_with_numbering: 7. Read books at Libreria Acqua Alta
snippets.description:
A city of art would be incomplete without something for those who are fond of the written word. This is the place to get lost in the creativity of amazing writers. You will even find a lot of furniture that has been made out of books. There are not only literary works and bestsellers on display but also books about Venice itself which can be very useful for tourists. The place closes at 8 pm though.
> #### Libreria Acqua Alta
>
> **Address**: Calle Longa Santa Maria Formosa (Campiello Del Tintor) | 5176 - Castello, 30122
>
> **Website**: [Libreria Acqua Alta](http://en.venezia.net/2014/02/04/libreria-acqua-alta-library-in-venice)

snippets.title: 8. Listen to jazz at Venice Jazz Club
snippets.title_with_numbering: 8. Listen to jazz at Venice Jazz Club
snippets.description:
Be sure to check the opening days before visiting, as it is not open on all days and also not during some months of the year. Many different genres of jazz such as Latin Jazz, Bossa Nova, etc., are played here. While the club does not simultaneously serve food and music, there are many talented musicians who will leave you spellbound with their mastery of music.

>
> **Address**: Dorsoduro 3102 | Ponte dei Pugni, S.Margherita, Venice, Italy
>
> **Website**: [Venice Jazz Club](http://venicejazzclub.weebly.com/)

snippets.title_with_numbering: 10. Taste some of the finest cocktails at Time Social Bar

snippets.title: 11. Solve an historic murder crime in the City of Masks
snippets.title_with_numbering: 11. Solve an historic murder crime in the City of Masks
snippets.description: Ditch the smartphone and follow a real paper map through the streets of Venice at night. Find the body and follow the clues against the clock to solve the 19th-century crime. It's a 2.5-hour detective hunt for the killer. The tour is not wheelchair friendly and children under 13 shouldn't participate. The operator provides snacks and drinks, plus all the props necessary. The whole event is excellently planned for a party of four, with transportation to the activity sites. They also offer hotel pick-up and drop-off. This may be an unusual night activity, but it's great fun if you're a bit of a sleuth.

snippets.title: 12. Gondola ride with romantic serenade and dinner
snippets.title_with_numbering: 12. Gondola ride with romantic serenade and dinner
snippets.description:
If you are looking for something memorable and romantic, then this is an activity not to be missed! Celebrate the City of Love's splendour on a 30-minute shared gondola ride with live music and serenades by the gondoliers. The “Venice and its Lagoon” was added to the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1987 for its charming canals & arching bridges, gondolas, alleyways, and stunning architecture. Navigate through the canals and take a glimpse of the city's stunning landmarks en route to your chosen restaurant. Look at the Accademia Bridge (Ponte dell'Accademia) which links the San Marco district with the Accademia gallery. Watch St. Mark's Square from a vantage point as it comes alive at night. Every corner you look has some elements of history. Its romantic ambiance can be hard to resist if you want to do the full nine yards of your proposal. With three restaurants options to choose from, all of them expertly serving Italian cuisine, you are in a treat for a wonderful evening.

> #### Gondola ride with romantic serenade and dinner
>
> **Price**: 97 USD 
>
> **Duration**: 2 hours 
>
> [Book Now](https://www.headout.com/tour/9750/italy/venice/godola-ride-with-romantic-serenade-and-dinner)

snippets.title: 13. Sunset cruise in a Venetian boat
snippets.title_with_numbering: 13. Sunset cruise in a Venetian boat
snippets.description: Another water activity is this wonderful sunset cruise on a Venetian boat. Explore the Venetian Lagoon and learn the secrets and views of the area while you enjoy your complimentary prosecco drinks. Non-alcoholic beverages can be served if required. Depart late afternoon, pass through some natural areas and then sit on the calm waters and watch the sunset in a blaze of color. The tour lasts for two very interesting hours as your guide shares his love of the city and rich history of the area. When you return, the lights of the city start to flicker on, to welcome you as you view St. Marks and the Doges Palace from the water
